traits.notes:
Edgemark at main site, uses 12.150.119.117 from WUC's IP block from AT&T
Phones at main site are on VLAN 20 with Edgemark

Remote sites do not have Edgemarks and do not connect to the Edgemark at HQ.  They connect to Momentum over the Internet.  Remote site phones are on VLAN 1 with the PCs.  Phones reach Momentum by routing through the MPLS routers, back to the main site and through its ASA.

SIP fixup must be disabled.  This has caused issues in the past with the remote phones not able to receive inbound calls or transfer calls.

Supported by CT Solutions

  • UTGS-IAL-vMCD, hosted in cloud (OTAVA), NIC is disabled. If this device is online it creates a conflict and takes the phones down.
  • Coretelligent via United Technology Group resells space in OTAVA to IAL. CT Solutions manages the Mitel environment
  • IAL-VMAS NICS are also disabled. will bring down Https://192.168.11.26/server - manager 8-25-2020
  • Two Mitel Systems - One Local at HQ - other in Cloud for Remote Sites
  • All sites outside of HQ (40 globally) rely on Mitel controllers hosted in OTAVA Datacenter located in Austin, TX 
  • Controller is reachable via Masergy MPLS (Controller IP is 192.168.11.20)
  • Masergy managed router (Cisco 1941) is MPLS router we monitor via ICMP.  Located in OTAVA datacntr ( TX-AUS-MASERGY-1-192.168.11.254)

1.    First Log into Sophos Central Portal to confirm if computer has the Sophos client installed
Use creds below.
2.    If computer name shows up on list, go to Symantec Cloud to begin remote removal
https://hostedendpoint.spn.com/home.aspx
Username dgray@moncriefair.com pw 5Danielle!
3.    Once inside the Symantec portal click on the “computers’ tab at the top and click on the machine that you have confirmed has the Sophos client installed.  
4.    Once you have clicked the computer you want to remove Symantec on you will be taken to the Computer Profile page.  In here at the bottom right side you will see “Remove service” in red  Click on this to remove the Symantec cloud agent.  After this you can go back and click “Delete Computer” in red at the upper right hand side.
There are currently only 14 machines left with Symantec on the network.  The DC and TS servers will be done after hours during a maintenance window.  Out of the 14, 3 computer seem to have no longer connected to the network in a very long time and can probably be deleted.  Just confirm with Alex Hartley before removal.  Still follow the process of removing the service FIRST then delete the computer.

**Prior to blocking or whitelisting an address in DarkTrace submit it for review to itdepartment@smiletrain.org**

User Mailboxes Migrated to Office365 Dec 2021, Exchange Decommissioned Mar 2022

They have some distributions lists that have external email addresses that need to be able to send and receive email with anyone within that list.  When creating these distribution lists and/or adding out external addresses as members, you need to add any external recipients to the Relay Profile Group, found in Administration > Directories > Profile Groups, and that will bypass the External to External Block.

Per Mimecast, mail from an external address to a distribution list that contains external addresses is going to trigger our External to External Blocked Senders policy. By default, we prevent external mail flow from passing through the Gateway. However, you can add these external recipients to the Relay Profile Group, found in Administration > Directories > Profile Groups, and that will bypass the External to External Block.
This Relay Profile Group is only utilized by this Blocked Senders Take No Action Policy. All other filters will remain in place.

Creating Distribution Lists must be done on the Exchange Server!

traits.account-number: See connectwise config - Masergy - MPLS Provider for needed login info to managed all sites
traits.notes:
Account Number: MC001475


Masergy provides the Managed Cisco 1941 Routers at all IAL locations that are moving to a new MPLS Backbone.  All equipment is owned and maintained by Masergy.  Masergy also provides Virtual Firewalls for Internet Connectivity in Dallas, London, and Tokyo for IAL locations.  These are shared Internet Connections and geographically located for load balancing purposes.  Internet is aggregated into 3 x 10Mbps (30Mbps Total).

Most IAL locations have 2 x T1 (3Mbps) connectivity to the Cloud.  IAL HQ, Miami (Cogent DC), and Austin (UTG / Artisan) will have Ethernet Based Circuits with varying speeds (see IAL Master Tracker on the U:\ Drive for full circuit details).

traits.name: RDS
traits.notes:
The entire RDS environment reboots nightly between 3:15 to 3:30 AM EST.  
Connection Broker reboots at 3AM EST.
The 8 RDS servers all reboot between 3:15 to 3:30AM EST.

A scheduled task is running a local powershell script on each RDS host server which runs at 2:30AM EST and 2:55AM EST, displaying to all of the users logged to save their work before the reboot happens.
Reboot is a scheduled procedure in Kaseya.

Each of the RDS servers is running a secondary login script located in c:\windows\system32\termlogon.cmd
This was setup and configured via the documentation provided here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/troubleshoot/windows-server/remote/set-up-logon-script-terminal-server-users
The purpose of this configuration was to deploy various fixes due to in place upgrades, including reg key injection and windows recently access file clearing.
These run once per server, and they create a file upon running located in the appdata folder per user: %appdata%\BVP

If the logon script should need to be modified, it should be updated on all 6 (at the time of this writing,) servers.


RDS is currently only accessible via a ForitClient VPN.  This is deployed to users automatically via Intune and Jamf.

traits.name: VPN to ATL
traits.notes:
Please note:
Do not manually setup VPN. Instead use these scripts.
Please remove any old VPN connections first to keep the user's PC clean.

\\bwfs01\PDAPPS\IT\scripts\AddMerakiVPN_CLT.ps1
\\bwfs01\PDAPPS\IT\scripts\AddMerakiVPN_ATL.ps1
Use VSA to copy the files locally to the user's PC then run as admin via Powershell.
Be sure to delete the local scripts once done.



The settings are listed in the table below.

This document is a quick guide for setting up VPN. It has PSK & hostnames for both locations
https://coretelligent.itglue.com/DOC-1460180-4756905

Meraki walk-through for VPN: https://documentation.meraki.com/MX/Client_VPN/Client_VPN_OS_Configuration

Windows VPN Settings:
VPN ProviderWindows (Built-in)
Connection NameBrightworth VPN
Server Name or Addressvpnatl.brightworth.com
VPN TypeL2TP/IPsec with pre-shared key
Pre-shared keyhttps://cortelligent.itglue.com/1460180/passwords/8232982
Type of sign-in infoUsername and Password
Username (optional)brightworth\username
Password (optional)ADPassword

Configure VPN Connection:
  1. (In Windows) Settings > Network and Internet
  2. Change adapter options
  3. Right-click VPN Connection > Properties
  4. Security Tab
    • Type of VPN
      • Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol with IPsec (L2TP/IPsec)
      • Data encryption: Optional encryption (connect even if no encryption)
    • Authentication
      • Allow these protocols
        • Check "Unencrypted password (PAP)"
        • Uncheck ALL other boxes
  5. Networking Tab
    1.  Select "Internet Protocol Version 4(TCP/IPv4)
    2. Click "Properties"
    3. Click on "Advanced"
    4. Insure that "Use default gateway on remote network" is UN-CHECKED!  (If checked, user will not be able to browse the internet when connected to VPN)
      1. Brightworth IT would like all remote user traffic to flow across the VPN so please do NOT uncheck that box
There may be an instance when the VPN connection just hangs when trying to Connect in Windows 10, the steps below may help verify the Properties are correct.

- Start > Run > C:\Windows\system32\rasphone.exe
- selected ATL connection > select Properties > Security tab
- make sure Type of VPN was set to L2TP/IPsec
- make sure Data encryption: Optional encryption (connect even if no encryption)
- checked box for "Unencrypted password (PAP)" (if checked, toggle off then back on)
- uncheck all other boxes in the protocols section
- click OK and save
- Click Connect, entered creds and it should connect (if you are viewing through Kaseya your session will be disconnected)
- Disconnect, then Connect using regular Win 10 selection method to verify the Connection works
User will need to use DUO Mobile to authenticate to VPN

We cannot log into the VPN with our admin account as it requires Duo push.

NOTE: VPN is not required for users to work in general, only specific users that have to access Legacy Adecco applications need VPN connectivity. Per Adecco, Users are not able to access VPN from Personal computers. Has to be a Adecco Domain joined computer. Adecco does not support MAC.

Since the merger with BioNTech, we’ve been working with the team in Germany to assure smooth and timely help desk support.  We acknowledge that this has not been seamless so we are implementing some changes, and offering some reminders, to improve your support experience.


German IT Support

  • The Help Desk based in Germany has changed their out-sourced service provider as well as their ticket routing process.  All of your tickets are now going directly to a triage team in Germany and will be redirected to us only when it is a service/system we support directly.  This will streamline ticket assignment to expedite response time.


Cambridge IT Support

  • Effective immediately, Coretelligent will be providing on-site support/walk up hours every Monday and Thursday.
  • Starting next week, I will make myself available to everyone for office hours every Tuesday and Wednesday from 11-12.  I can be reached via teams (chat or call) to field any questions/concerns. If you need more time, I’m happy to schedule meetings as well.


Account Lock Out

  • If you can’t log into email or any other BioNTech application (ServiceNow, SecuMail, etc.) please check your account in FastPass FIRST, before you call/text/email/chat/submit a ticket.  BioNTech accounts will periodically lock out for a myriad of reasons (including 3 incorrect password attempts).  Everyone can unlock their own account.  We get more requests about this than any other issue, and 9 times out of 10 you can fix it without IT help.  Note: be sure to include “001” before your cell number to access your FastPass pin.
  • If you cannot unlock your account using FastPass, submit a ticket using ServiceNow if you can.   If you cannot log into ServiceNow, you can email help@core.tech or call the Coretelligent remote team at 781-247-4900.
  • Link: FastPass Self-Service


Submitting Tickets

  • All IT support requests should be submitted through ServiceNow.  You will be able to see all your open tickets through this portal and can go back into each ticket any time to view activity and/or request updates.
  • If you have sent in a ticket and do not receive an response in a reasonable amount of time (e.g. 1 business day), email Coretelligent (help@core.tech) with your request and reference your ServiceNow ticket number.  If we can address it directly while we’re waiting for the triage/assignment process, we will.  We can also follow up on your behalf.
  • If you need access to a folder managed by Germany (aka not Egnyte), DO NOT submit a ticket or they will close it.  You must ask your German business counterpart to submit a request for access per their SOP, and that counterpart must open a ticket on your behalf.
  • Link:  BioNTech Service Portal 


Quick Links to FastPass and ServiceNow can be found here: https://neontherapeutics.sharepoint.com/sites/Intranet. 

For your reference, I’ve also added a list of applications that use the BioNTech password vs the legacy Neon password.


I will be putting together some additional information and coordinating a few refresher training sessions over the next couple of weeks to assure everyone is confident on the process. 


I want you all to get the support you need, and we will be doing our best to streamline/improve our processes and accessibility.  Your feedback continues to be welcomed!


-Fran

traits.support-information:
Northern Business Machines (NBM) performs the maintenance and ships the supplies to client. More information can be found within each of the machine's configurations. 

Note about Scan to SMB: Guidepost has several VLANs for proper network segmentation. All of these printers are on VLAN 96. If for whatever reason these printers are moved to a different wall jack, we must change the switchport from an access port to a trunk port and add them to VLAN 103. This will ensure they can reach GPGE-FP01.

As far as path is concerned, they need to be typed as follows \\gpge-fp01.guidepost.lan\files\Home\username\FolderForScannedDocs. The SVC_Scanner account can be used to authenticate to all the file shares. Login/Password information can be found on CoreSecret.  

HP LJ MFP M425dn printers do not understand DFS. These printers will only work with a regular shared folder on the server. Alexia's Scanning to SMB works as follows:

  • Setup Shared folder on GPGE-UTIL called Scanning.
  • Created subfolder called apearsall
  • Setup permissions so Domain Users have access to the Scanning folder but only Alexia has access to the APearsall Subfolder
  • On the printer, set up Scan to SMB as follows: \\192.168.103.14\Scanning\apearsall
  • Set up mapped drive for Alexia
traits.notes:
Most of the partners have their own printers as well. These can also be found shared out through the GPGE-FP01 Server as well.
